intro: Leptolaena raymondii, commonly known as Raymond's holly, is a small evergreen shrub native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and other shrubs adapted to acidic soils. The plant is characterized by its dense, glossy foliage and small, dark green leaves that are typically arranged in whorls. It produces clusters of white, bell-shaped flowers in spring, followed by bright red berries that are attractive to birds. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
